forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind around 3 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain between 8am and 4pm. Mostly cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 3 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the early hours, a blanket of clouds envelops Downtown San Francisco, settling into the city with a companionable chill as the temperature hovers at a gentle 56 degrees. The muted south-southeast breeze whispers through the streets, promising a day that requires a layer or two, perhaps a light jacket to guard against the coolness that lingers in the air. As the sun climbs, the clouds will likely play accomplice to the slivers of late morning light, hinting at the possibility of occasional rain with a modest chance of showers. Expect the afternoon to cool further, as the temperature dips towards 60, leaving hints of drizzle in its wake.

The skyline, partially shrouded in fog, offers a postcard view of soft silhouettes against a backdrop of gray. Today’s vibe leans into the serene, inviting exploration of cozy cafés or the spirited atmosphere of the local bookstore, where one can sip warm beverages while exiting the bustle outside. The weather, although somewhat overcast, emits an enticing quality—a perfect reason to explore the nooks and crannies of the city, to find a quiet courtyard or perhaps catch a fleeting glimpse of the Golden Gate Bridge as it diffuses in and out of sight through the fog. Ready your attire for the day, layering up as a gentle reminder that the warmth of home extends into every corner of the city.
